intro: Phyllorkis andersonii, commonly known as the Anderson's phyllorkis, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun exposure. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and yellow, appearing in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
